amendatorysection.catchline: Cities of the metropolitan class; county boards; concurrent jurisdiction over watercourses.
amendatorysection.para: The city council of any city of the metropolitan class shall have concurrent jurisdiction with the county board of any county having a population of two hundred thousand inhabitants or more, and the power to cause all natural watercourses, as defined in section 31-228, which are within its corporate limits or within three miles thereof, to be kept clean and free of obstructions in such manner as to permit the natural flow thereof.
